nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,61 @@
+package com.azure.cosmos.implementation;

nodes.bodyText:
should this be list or Iterable? does indexing feedRange.get(1) a meaningful action?
If not probably Iterable is more suitable.
thought?

I am fine with List as compared to Iterable - as it gives user more flexibility on not having to cast it to lists or other >Iterables.
Though I am wondering why are we not using CosmosPagedIterable<FeedRange>


fabianm (response): Reason for using List of Iterable was that size will be often used by callers. Not using ComsosPagedIterable because it will always be exactly one page (IO op)
Reason why I chose List over Iterable is that it allows to get the size efficiently - which I think most callers would need.
List<FeedRange> feedRanges = new ArrayList<FeedRange>(feedRanges.size());

NIT: Can be final.
Also, we can use of java streams as well -
final List<FeedRange> feedRanges = partitionKeyRangeList.stream().map(pkRange -> toFeedRange(pkRange)).collect(Collectors.toList())
Fixed

our implementation is async. the async suffix not needed.
here and other places.
I agree, we should just keep the async word in the class name, and remove it from the APIs.
Fixed
ditto on Async suffix. as above.
Fixed
ranges.isEmpty()
final List<Range<String>> feedRanges = new ArrayList<>(partitionKeyRangeList.size);
header missing.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,503 @@

nodes.bodyText:
as an optimization; There are two public methods in the parent class (fromJsonString and toJsonString).
as fromJsonString is the only to instantiate, you could cache the json value and return the same in the toJsonString

Not all concrete classes inheriting form this are immutable - so the cached json might not be the current one. Skipping this for now - can be introduced later if perf testing indicates a problem there.
I would use checkNotNull pattern that you used elsewhere to be consistent and more succinct
Fixed

I would use checkNotNull pattern that you used elsewhere to be consistent and more succinct.
here and everywhere else in the new code.
Fixed
why do we need the both version async and sync accept?

Discussed offline - usage of the visitors will be added when consuming the FeedRange Api in feedRanges - will double check then which of them are still needed etc. (I only ported those I believe we will need - but I am porting a moving target - so this is work in progress)
Shouldn't this be Flux<FeedRange> or CosmosPagedFlux<FeedRange> ? What is the benefit of Mono<List<FeedRange>> - as that will always have just one list of FeedRange ?
Yes - will always be just one returned list - never pages or multiple requests/IO operations
So intentionally using Mono<List> - Flux would inidcate that there could be multiple asynchronous values
What about 304 (NOT_MODIFIED) - does that not count in maximum success code?

3xx are Redirection status codes.
2xx - success
3xx - redirection
4xx - client failure
5xx - service failure
Should we log the exception here for our own debugging purposes?
Fixed
